Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

Genovese Pesto Mint™ offers a profoundly different mint experience. The initial cooling menthol “blast” is replaced by a smooth, sweet, and herbaceous flavour with distinct notes of basil, citrus, and warm spice. Its leaves are larger and more tender than traditional mint, with a vibrant green colour and a potent, yet gentle, aroma.

2. The Savoury Mint Revolution

This mint is a versatile herb that seamlessly integrates into dishes where traditional mint would be overpowering.

  • The Ultimate Pesto: It creates a stunningly complex and refreshing pesto, either on its own or blended with basil. It pairs exceptionally well with peas, feta, and lamb, creating a more nuanced and sophisticated flavour profile.
  • Salads & Garnishes: A game-changer in salads, grain bowls, and as a garnish for soups and roasted vegetables, providing a fresh, herbal lift without the dominant cooling sensation.
  • Modern Cocktails & Sauces: Allows for the use of mint in delicate cocktails without overwhelming other ingredients. It also forms the base for innovative sauces for fish, poultry, and roasted carrots.
3. The Harvest and Yield

The plant is a vigorous but well-behaved perennial. Regular harvesting of the top leaves encourages bushy, compact growth. Supplied as an RFID seed pad, it provides a continuous yield of 20–30g of large, aromatic leaves per week.
